covidcastR 0.1.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

Getting started with covidcastR

Source: vignettes/covidcastR.Rmd
covidcastR.Rmd

This package exposes only one function: the ?covidcast_signal function allows users to retrieve a data frame (tibble) of values from the COVIDcast API. Using this function, you can fetch any data you may be interested in analyzing, then use other R packages to graph results, make maps, fit models, or join the data with data from other sources.

Installing

This package is not on CRAN yet, so it can be installed using the devtools package:

devtools::install_github("cmu-delphi/covidcast", subdir = "clients/covidcastR")

Example use

For full usage information, see the function documentation at help(covidcast_signal).

To obtain smoothed estimates of COVID-like illness from our Facebook survey for every county in the United States between 2020-05-01 and 2020-05-07:

library(covidcastR)

suppressMessages(
    covidcast_signal("fb-survey", "smoothed_cli", start_day = "20200501",
                     end_day = "20200507")
)
## # A tibble: 7,080 x 6
##    geo_value time_value direction value stderr sample_size
##    <chr>     <date>         <int> <dbl>  <dbl>       <dbl>
##  1 01000     2020-05-01         0 0.823  0.126       1722.
##  2 01001     2020-05-01         1 1.26   0.800        116.
##  3 01003     2020-05-01         0 0.665  0.309        584.
##  4 01015     2020-05-01         0 0.575  0.527        123.
##  5 01031     2020-05-01        NA 0.408  0.347        115.
##  6 01045     2020-05-01        NA 0.926  0.466        111.
##  7 01051     2020-05-01         0 1.19   0.545        151.
##  8 01069     2020-05-01         1 1.51   0.631        241.
##  9 01071     2020-05-01         1 1.76   1.07         112.
## 10 01073     2020-05-01         0 0.449  0.231        488.
## # … with 7,070 more rows

Notice the use of ?suppressMessages to hide progress reporting from the function as it downloads the data; if you download particularly large amounts of data, you may prefer to allow the progress reporting so you know how long to wait.

Note that geo_value is the FIPS code for each reported county; counties with insufficient sample size are not reported. The API documentation specifies how geographies are identified.

To request estimates for states instead of counties:

suppressMessages(
    covidcast_signal("fb-survey", "smoothed_cli", start_day = "20200501",
                     end_day = "20200507", geo_type = "state")
)
## # A tibble: 357 x 6
##    geo_value time_value direction value stderr sample_size
##    <chr>     <date>         <int> <dbl>  <dbl>       <dbl>
##  1 ak        2020-05-01        -1 0.461 0.159        1606 
##  2 al        2020-05-01         0 0.700 0.0826       7540.
##  3 ar        2020-05-01        -1 0.760 0.104        4921.
##  4 az        2020-05-01         0 0.567 0.0618      11221.
##  5 ca        2020-05-01         0 0.365 0.0228      51870.
##  6 co        2020-05-01        -1 0.646 0.0685      10106.
##  7 ct        2020-05-01         0 0.511 0.0642       8786 
##  8 dc        2020-05-01         1 0.542 0.261         685 
##  9 de        2020-05-01         0 0.585 0.125        2645.
## 10 fl        2020-05-01         0 0.500 0.0313      38074 
## # … with 347 more rows
